headline: 3 Magnificent S&P 500 Dividend Stocks Down as Much as 23% to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: As energy prices have dipped over the past year (West Texas Intermediate crude oil is down 14.3%), investors should head for the oil patch.  Here they can pick up shares of Occidental Petroleum (NYSE: OXY), ConocoPhillips (NYSE: COP), with their forward dividend yields of 2.1% and 3.5%, respectively, along with Devon Energy (NYSE: DVN) and its 2.8% forward dividend yield.  The conglomerate first purchased shares of the integrated energy company in 2019, and today, it's the sixth-largest position in the Berkshire Hathaway portfolio.
